intro: Reseda orientalis, commonly known as oriental madder, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots contain a red dye called alizarin, which has been historically used in textile dyeing. Reseda orientalis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
